intro: Spergularia arbuscula, commonly known as the red sand-rat, is a flowering plant in the Caryophyllaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically thrives in sandy or gravelly soils, often found in arid or semi-arid regions. The plant produces small, pink to red flowers that bloom in summer, and its leaves are usually narrow and succulent. It is adapted to withstand drought conditions and has a deep root system to access water. Spergularia arbuscula is also known for its ability to colonize disturbed soils and is sometimes considered a weed in certain areas.
